Difficult to tame evil ghosts and spirits,

The present Buddha now speaks of it.
The future Buddha will speak of it.

This mudrā is the Buddha himself.
Benefiting all sentient beings.
By the bright great majestic virtue,
Subjugating all sages.
Within a distance of five yojanas,
Preventing other honored ones from descending.
Even the bodhisattvas on the tenth ground,
Become confused and lose their original mind.

Who are able to manifest spiritual powers?
The accomplished person of wisdom,

The ground of evil māras and obstacles,

The merits and benefits,
Praising the power of majestic virtue.
If the wise one receives and upholds it,
They will always be unobstructed.
The Great Teacher Tathāgata said,
But cannot praise it.
For those who cultivate the Buddha's crown,
They will quickly attain accomplishment.

analyzed: 次結普通一切佛頂成就印。

Clench the two wings inside,
Extend the forbearance and vow fingers upright,
And bend the upper joints together.
This is used commonly for all purposes.
Recite the mantra seven times.
Disperse the mudrā above the head.

It is like inviting the Buddha to observe.

Dragons, and asura multitudes,
All evil rākṣasas,
And the māras,
By the majestic virtue of this mantra,
Fear and terror are all dissolved.
If one attains this mudrā,
One can obtain all forms of happiness.
The king of the country and the world, etc.
Always benefit them.
Those who wish to seek the benefits of the Dharma
Will definitely attain them.
The universal mantra king
Because of accomplishing the fruits and rewards.

Recite the great mantra seven times.
Next, form the white parasol.
The great mudra of the fundamental [mantra].
Join the two hands together with the palms facing each other.
Bend the index fingers and tuck them into the palms.

original: 以其禪智面。🔽並押戒方甲。

Recite the mantra seven times.
Then, scatter [the mudra] above the head.
The mantra states:

is unsurpassed in excellence,
is the power of the Buddha's great compassion,
flowing out like the lion's roar,
empowered by all Buddhas,
great compassion illuminating the darkness of sorrow,
profoundly knowing the stainless,
causing all auspiciousness,
the Bodhisattvas and all gods,
are unable to obstruct it,
attaining irreversibility,
all are at ease,
various poisons cannot harm it,
the devas and nagas dare not approach,
writing and reciting it,
quickly attaining siddhi,
next, hold the rosary,
empower it seven times,
hold it to the crown of the head,
then recite it.
One hundred and eight or one thousand and eight.
Gather the beads and place them in their original position.
Again form the mudra of the main deity.
Abide in samādhi.
Praise the Buddha's merits.
Make offerings as presented before.

but now for practitioners,
I have briefly collected a few secret essentials.
If one delights in the great Dharma,
one should seek abhiṣeka from a teacher.
Having received the samaya empowerment,
one should extensively inquire and learn.
